features: 【Ergonomic Design】-Scientific ergonomic design encourages healthy neutral "handshake" wrist and arm positions for smoother movement and less overall strain. (Note: it is a right-handed mouse)
【More Adjustment】-800 / 1200 / 2000 / 3200 DPI Resolution Optical Tracking Technology provides more sensitivity than standard optical mice for smooth and precise tracking on a wide range of surfaces.
【Useful Page Buttons】-Added next/previous buttons provide convenience when webpage browsing; the superior choice for internet surfers, gamers and people who work at length at the computer.
【No Deed for Battery】-Plug and Play mouse with USB 2.0 interface, easy to start to use with standard setting function. High quality rubber coating surface gives it a feel-good touch
【Wide compatibility】-Compatible with Windows 7/8/10 / Vista / XP / 2000, Mac OS, Linux (NOTE: the forward and backward buttons are not recognized on Mac). Plug and play.

manufacturerProductDescription.media_text: Wired Vertical Ergonomic Mouse Plug & Play This ergonomic mouse is full of vitality, innovation.By changing the way you use your wrist and arms, you will effectively reduce pain and discomfort.Add rubber oil coating to prevent sweaty fingers from sliding. From the office to gaming, using the optical vertical mouse is comfortable and healthy. Ergonomic Design Scientific ergonomic design encourages healthy neutral "handshake" wrist and arm positions for smoother movement and less overall strain. Useful Page Buttons Added next/previous buttons provide convenience when webpage browsing; the superior choice for internet surfers, gamers and people who work at length at the computer. Multiple Function This wired Ergonomic mouse Designed DPI button and 3D scroll wheel, which are very convenient while surfing Internet. Work naturally Work comfortably for long periods of time, while preventing arm and wrist complains.Comfortable thumb rest and rubber coating for perfect grip. Compatible Systems Windows 2000Windows XPWindows Vista, Windows 7, Windows 8, Windows 10 Linux , AndroidMac OS X (The previous/next page thumb buttons are not recognized on the Mac OS X.) Package Contents 1 x Vertical Ergonomic Optical Mouse( It is more suitable for big hands). NOTE: It will take several days to get used to.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on December 22, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars These actually work!
reviews.reviewText: I was having hand cramps from my office job, which I work 8 hrs a day and at the end of the month there’s a job I have to do that required constant clicking and my old mouse started hurting my wrists so I quickly looked for a good alternative.Thankfully I found this mouse and it actually works! My hand doesn’t hurt anymore and it’s been months since I’ve started using it.I am really glad to have bought this product cuz otherwise I don’t know how I would get through the end of the month.The design also looks really cool and I like that it lights up. It still has that professional feel so I’m not worried about customers saying anything and in fact I’ve gotten components about it.If I had one complaint it’s that in the beginning I had to make sure it was plugged into the computer firmly cuz it would come out but once I fixed that I have had no recurring problems with the connections.The price años was great for the design, the fact that it lights up and the ergonomic feature I thought it would be a lot more but this was actually really affordable. I got mine for $12.60Overall great purchase and great price too!Durability 5/5Price 5/5Comfort 5/5

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on January 4, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Light and comfortable
reviews.reviewText: I ended up buying a second one of these. While not at "solid" mouse, it is inexpensive and a pretty good fit for my hand. I also like the angle as it reduces the stress on my wrist. The only thing I didn't like was the mouse switches for the left and right mouse buttons. They had almost no tactile feedback and were silent. I actually like the clickyness that I have with other mice. So, I ended up purchasing replacement switches which I had to solder. Not too difficult, but be warned that in order to take apart the mouse, you have to remove the bottom pads, 4 screws, and then you have to remove the top to get to 2 additional screws so you can remove the side of the mouse. To get to those screws, you have to pop the top (the part where you press down for the left and right mouse buttons). It is held in place by 2 clips that you can access on the underside. You can see in the included photo the 3 top parts separated if you also wish to replace the switches. I ended up using the Kailh GM 4.0 and 8.0 switches. Not sure which I will prefer, but both of those switches offer much better tactile feedback and should have a much greater duty cycle.The switches that were replaced are the smaller ones to the left (in the picture). The red switches are the GM 4.0 and the larger black ones are the 8.0's. I ordered the 8 pack which includes 4 red switches and 4 black switches.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on September 15, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 4.0 out of 5 stars Excellent for SMALL hands
reviews.reviewText: The ergonomic shape was fantastic. However it is ultimately only great for small hands. It sat too far forward in my hand and I eventually went with a Larger Vertical mouse that filled my hand. If it were 1/4 to 1/2 inch longer in the body it would be perfect for me. May be perfect for you IF you have small hands.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on November 1, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars If you have wrist issues due to your mouse, get this!!!
reviews.reviewText: For the money, this is a great mouse! If you have carpal tunnel due to typing and using a mouse, this mouse is for you! My wrist pain WENT AWAY within a few days after using this mouse. I like it so much I bought one for my office computer! Great price, nice quality for the price. Highly recommend. No battery needed, just plug in to your computer.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on November 5, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 1.0 out of 5 stars don't do it
reviews.reviewText: this is a cheap knockoff of the anker ergo. 1 not for large hands, 2. not well put together, feels like i could squish it and break it 3. plastic molding process overlaps and not properly trimmed or de-burred, the side was dragging on the mousepad. only good thing about it is that it has a metal wheel and a cloth covered cable. #1. biggest issue for me, this is NOT FOR LARGE HANDS. this is a standard average size ergo, nothing more.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on September 7, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 3.0 out of 5 stars A solid mouse for the price but...
reviews.reviewText: I love vertical mice. I've had a few Ankers over the years. This one looked so similar and the price was fantastic so I took the plunge. I find it fits in my hand the same way. Perhaps it feels slightly less hefty, but I'm very satisfied with the performance. I was experiencing some dancing and mouse wheel 'slippage' but then I tested and replaced the batteries and things were back to normal. (no it doesn't have a low battery warning). I use my mouse all day every day and I don't feel like it uses batteries any faster than it should btw. So I'd say my experience is positive!** update - despite having replaced my batteries, I AM still experiencing wheel slippage -- where I scroll up but it goes down a bit too... this wasn't happening for some time... but something has changed I guess. :(

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on February 24, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars very comfortable and so far not bad to adjust to
reviews.reviewText: first - its a wired mouse so the battery rating doesn't count but I didn't want to ding the product for a bad battery when it doesn't have one at all. That said - just got it and started using it right away. It will take a little while to get used to this different style of mouse but I have to say its super responsive, really comfortable and easy to use. I got it as i have a lot of pain in my hands, lower arm and some in my wrist and it does seem to alleviate that when i use it. It remains to be seen if it completely makes it go away after only using it for awhile but I am feeling confident that its going to be very helpful towards that goal.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on August 29, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 2.0 out of 5 stars Scroll Wheel is going bad already
reviews.reviewText: I use the scroll wheel a lot for work and it's already going bad after 6 or 7 months. Super squeeky and sometimes just "glitches" at times. Would not recommend if you plan to use this feature on a regular basis.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United Kingdom on January 29, 2024
reviews.reviewText: Have been using various ergonomic mice (mouses 🤓) for some years now. Recently restarted my gaming career and needed something for long FPS sessions. This does very well for general use and is comfy for large hands like it says (I'm 6ft 1 inch tall).Only gripe is that sometimes when you click the right button to zoom with a sniper rifle, the left button for shooting doesn't work. Lost a melee rush in Zombie Army Trilogy because of this.
Ottimo: costo contenuto, design efficace, piena funzione ergonomica.Mi ha fatto passare il mal di spalla che avevo usando un mouse più classico.

De prime abord, peut paraitre complexe à prendre en main, mais cette sentation disparait rapidement (au bout de deux jours pour moi).La prise en main est donc aisée, rapide, et une facilité d'adaptation certaine. Elle est légère, maniable, esthétique; pas trop lourde malgré la présence de la pile (non fournie avec le pack).Néanmoins deux points noirs :-> Dongle wifi très dur à retirer de la souris la première fois (queelle idée de concevoir le produit sans place pour un ongle permettant de glisser le doigt sous le dongle)-> la molette ne fonctionne pas normalement en clic molette (sur certains cran, très dure à utiliser)Dommage; bien, mais peut mieux faire.

Bra värde för pengarna! Enda nackdelarna skulle väl vara att den går i power-save efter ett tag (vilket i sig kan tyckas är ok men borde gå att stänga av) och då väcks genom tryck på någon musknapp. Denna tryckning går vidare till operativsystemet vilket innebär att man måste klicka på något (vä eller hö) för att väcka musen. Irriterande. Klicket för att väcka borde bara just väcka.Sen är den lite lätt oxå, några gram til hade höjd komforten. Men är billig och man får mycket mus per krona!
